commit_message:
Use Tempest 'all' tox env

Tempest recently moved tox default
to py3 including all-plugin env.
-https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703011/

This will fail the py2 jobs which are using
all-plugin tox env. Because tox all-plugin
env var enable the sitepackages=True. Py2 jobs
install the tempest plugins on py2 and all-plugin
tox try to find the installed plugins on py3 which
cause no test to run and fail the job.

tox all-plugin has been deprecated since long and not
supposed to use for plugins who already in migrated to
separate repo in queens cycle.

Enable designate-tempest-plugin and using tox 'all' env
to fix the issue.

Change-Id: Ib1a2be90c0b3dbacc6daf52f0fc6f326ab47fc98
Closes-Bug: 1862240

commit_message:
Fix missing OS_CLOUD env var

We have some commands that need authentication credentials. Currently we
forgot to set OS_CLOUD in some places so only using the rc file works.
This patch updates the missing OS_CLOUD vars.

Change-Id: I5a115c355b5933714c30ce11c8e7b76da755c817

config-download directly.

It helps to have less config files that aren't really useful.

"}]
commit_message:
container_puppet_config: introduce puppet_config_content

Instead of giving a configuration file, allow to give a dict param
directly.

I'll avoid to use the container-puppet-tasksX.json files that are only
used by this module.
In THT, we will call the module with the right data generated by
config-download directly.

It helps to have less config files that aren't really useful.

Note: puppet_config and puppet_config_content are mutually exclusive.

Change-Id: I91c27631c47770e21c7c7344b2e2d967ca412a9f

commit_message:
Fix ipxe interface to perform ipxe boot without ipxe_enabled enabled

When ipxe hardware interface is in use, the node should always be boot
with iPXE disregards the deprecated configuration option [pxe]ipxe_enabled.

Story: 2007003
Task: 37779

Change-Id: Ia658ddc966e13a7ce973eccd9c42e40a3da406f4
(cherry picked from commit f61624e0693a0b2ccba46b271d0fb83e191f5077)

commit_message:
Use override-checkout instead of override-branch

The former also makes sure to use the job definitions from the
respective branch, not only the source code.

Story: #2007282
Task: #38734
Change-Id: Id730b2d6bdd58da1fbe4c5fa24442281d5a69e5b

commit_message:
Fix for ingress/egress rules tests.

Openstack API interface changed.
If rules are created with full permissions (ports 1 - 65535),
they are created with ports "null"
instead of (ports 1 - 65535).

Change-Id: I24d1a0016f76f6813a9f62294e7eeb9785fa711b

messages:
[{'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-02-04 17:28:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2020-02-04 18:43:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Is it retired if stable branches are still active? (Genuine question!)'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2020-02-04 20:48:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2020-02-04 20:49:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Thank you, Nate.'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2020-02-04 20:50:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

> Is it retired if stable branches are still active? (Genuine
 > question!)

Hmm, good point. Stable branches are open for security and bug fixes, and can still produce deliverables (stable maintenance releases).'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2020-02-04 21:56:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Zane's point is exactly why this wasn't done previously. Since the stable branches are still "official" and "supported" until at least 2020-10-10 (https://releases.openstack.org/) we did not take this action.
In the Octavia team's retirement process for neutron-lbaas, we have paused at step 4 (https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#retiring-a-project) as we are still maintaining the stable branches and gates.
Let me know if we need to take a different approach on this and/or accelerate our retirement process.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2020-02-05 04:49:19.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from retire-neutron-lbaas to project-update'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-02-05 10:05:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Good question. I think it's a grey area, as I could not find any historical example. Looking at the rest of the file, there is no deliverable in legacy.yaml that would still have stable branches...

The alternative is to mark it "release-management: deprecated" so that it stays in governance but does not make relmgt automation worried when it's missing.

Let me propose that instead.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-02-05 10:10:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-02-05 13:34:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-02-05 14:12:00.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from retire-neutron-lbaas to project-update'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-02-05 14:15:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1

> Good question. I think it's a grey area, as I could not find any
 > historical example. Looking at the rest of the file, there is no
 > deliverable in legacy.yaml that would still have stable branches...
 
Indeed, people use to wait for this.

I am fine with introducing a "deprecated" value. However, now that we've introduced a precedent, we should leverage this for other projects :D

ttx, could you do a call on the MLs for projects that would like to retire in the future?'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-02-05 14:20:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> > Good question. I think it's a grey area, as I could not find any
 > > historical example. Looking at the rest of the file, there is no
 > > deliverable in legacy.yaml that would still have stable
 > branches...
 > 
 > Indeed, people use to wait for this.
 > 
 > I am fine with introducing a "deprecated" value. However, now that
 > we've introduced a precedent, we should leverage this for other
 > projects :D
 > 
 > ttx, could you do a call on the MLs for projects that would like to
 > retire in the future?

My bad, it was an existing thing. Good for me as is.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2020-02-05 15:04:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2020-02-05 15:28:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2020-02-05 16:04:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-02-05 18:53:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2020-02-05 20:04:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2020-02-10 21:48:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-02-12 10:23:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-04 17:28:44.000000000', 'message': 'Mark long-gone neutron-lbaas legacy

When neutron-lbaas[-dashboard] was retired[1] in May, 2019, the
governance repository was not updated.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/658493/

Change-Id: Id49c8e2db4d79d3f3bebd6dbc14fff0950d3200b
'}, {'created': '2020-02-05 10:10:24.000000000', 'message': "neutron-lbaas was retired in Ussuri

When neutron-lbaas[-dashboard] was retired[1] in May, 2019, it
was kept in the governance repository since it still has stable
branches. We should mark it as 'deprecated' from a release management
perspective so that we do not expect it to be present in future
releases.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/658493/

Change-Id: Id49c8e2db4d79d3f3bebd6dbc14fff0950d3200b
"}]
commit_message:
neutron-lbaas was retired in Ussuri

When neutron-lbaas[-dashboard] was retired[1] in May, 2019, it
was kept in the governance repository since it still has stable
branches. We should mark it as 'deprecated' from a release management
perspective so that we do not expect it to be present in future
releases.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/658493/

Change-Id: Id49c8e2db4d79d3f3bebd6dbc14fff0950d3200b

No more releases of networking-ovn

it no longer requires separate release management.

commit_message:
Notify clients of series upgrade

When the percona cluster is undergoing a series upgrade, clients
should suspend db activity in their hooks (like db migrations).

This change sents a notification of upgrade

Change-Id: I9d02180fcb0fec6bd017c6150bfca5963896fd2f

[{'created': '2020-02-05 20:48:56.000000000', 'message': 'Enable stack status output for tripleo deploy

At somewhere along the line, we lost the heat stack status output
indicating what progress was being made while waiting for a stack to
build. This change sets verbosity to True for the tripleo deploy command
so that the output is always shown.

Change-Id: Id349dbc8a554c2fa542b986062e708bbc14da714
'}]
commit_message:
Enable stack status output for tripleo deploy

At somewhere along the line, we lost the heat stack status output
indicating what progress was being made while waiting for a stack to
build. This change sets verbosity to True for the tripleo deploy command
so that the output is always shown.

Change-Id: Id349dbc8a554c2fa542b986062e708bbc14da714

commit_message:
Remove ingress permissions from ServiceAccount

With the removal of OpenShift Routes support we don't need permissions
to access it anymore. Same happens with Ingress resources.

Change-Id: I9ba464c9c485e4f186dd02763a6ef4c270df9e77

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22629, 'name': 'Michal Nasiadka', 'email': 'mnasiadka@gmail.com', 'username': 'mnasiadka'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2020-02-11 16:43:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2020-02-11 16:43:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2020-02-11 16:45:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-02-11 16:47:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2020-02-11 16:47:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2020-02-12 09:17:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This is breaking centos-8 image builds.

Those builds use package installation for virtualenv and pip since [1], and the python3-virtualenv version distributed with centos 8 is 15.1.0. With this version, we get the following error:

venv: error: unrecognized arguments: --seeder=pip

[1] - https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/18215274d895b4b6104c5d977c00b623568646b2'}, {'account_id': 16312, 'date': '2020-02-12 09:39:49.000000000', 'content': 'Created a revert of this change as I799982d9c023141cf612901084d4ecbd4447e969'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-11 16:43:06.000000000', 'message': 'Use virtualenv --seeder=pip so that libs are accessible

New virtualenv will by default use a common location for seed libs like
setuptools, wheel, and pip. Unfortunately this breaks if root installs
the virtualenv and other users are expected to use it because these
other users cannot access /root/.local (where the files are stashed).

We fix this by using --seeder=pip which will install all of those libs
into the virtualenv itself.

Change-Id: I4922ea50e31dceda96f545a0d409c0d7dc022e19
'}]
commit_message:
Use virtualenv --seeder=pip so that libs are accessible

New virtualenv will by default use a common location for seed libs like
setuptools, wheel, and pip. Unfortunately this breaks if root installs
the virtualenv and other users are expected to use it because these
other users cannot access /root/.local (where the files are stashed).

We fix this by using --seeder=pip which will install all of those libs
into the virtualenv itself.

Change-Id: I4922ea50e31dceda96f545a0d409c0d7dc022e19

commit_message:
Override virtualenv to a version < 20

There are errors with the recently released virtualenv 20.0.1 which
comes preinstalled on gate images prepared by infra. As a hotfix
override to some previous version until we can find the real fix.

Change-Id: I3b447557f013934719aa357efeffb093c7f6bd95
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/707133

Note: this change has been initially merged only to stable branches.

commit_message:
Consume virtualbmc from pip packages

The virtualbmc master has dropped support for Python 2, breaking
stable CI jobs. Since we expect this to be a one-time breakage,
limit the existing stable branches to virtualbmc in upper-constraints
by removing it from required projects in the CI jobs.

Note: this change has been initially merged only to stable branches.
However, I've discovered that ironic-tempest-plugin runs stable jobs
with master Zuul configuration, so they still pull virtualbmc from git.
Since we don't often need to depend on virtualbmc patches, I think
the easiest choice is to consume it from global-requirements.

Change-Id: I15464410c9e74b915a647bffbaac02770d15f6b2

commit_message:
Enable g-reg service in stable jobs

Stable branches of devstack relies on it as a marker to initialize
the glance database. It's no longer enabled in Zuul definitions,
breaking our stable jobs. Enable it until we have a better fix.

Story: #2007282
Task: #38734
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/707101
Change-Id: I2f8d4d51f8f3a0b6235b942c516d22146302bf40

commit_message:
Fix token auth error if federated_groups_id is empty list

`federation_group_ids` could be zero length list, so deciding whether
a token is federated by checking if it is none.

Change-Id: I0f4b9e24d949aa4838ee721a165999b29c684d32
Closes-Bug: #1856962
(cherry picked from commit f0d964e66675037d62ad17847a966e71720dbd54)

[{'created': '2020-02-05 12:53:35.000000000', 'message': 'Dynamically include generate-config tasks

The generate-config tasks which run on the host to generate config data
under /var/lib/config-data, only run at step1.

There are several tasks that used a when statement to only run the
related tasks at step1. This patch moves all the related generate-config
tasks to a separate tasks file, which can then be dynamically included
at step1.

Using a dynamic include results in less tasks being skipped, which can
save several minutes at scale. This results in 4 less tasks that need to
be skipped at steps 2-5, which equates to 16 tasks overall.

Change-Id: Ifdddcb13362e26babedd47e674089fb0e2a37994
(cherry picked from commit c8bc412e4f2aaa0c97fd107f7a5acd698c7224ff)

commit_message:
Dynamically include generate-config tasks

The generate-config tasks which run on the host to generate config data
under /var/lib/config-data, only run at step1.

There are several tasks that used a when statement to only run the
related tasks at step1. This patch moves all the related generate-config
tasks to a separate tasks file, which can then be dynamically included
at step1.

Using a dynamic include results in less tasks being skipped, which can
save several minutes at scale. This results in 4 less tasks that need to
be skipped at steps 2-5, which equates to 16 tasks overall.

Change-Id: Ifdddcb13362e26babedd47e674089fb0e2a37994
(cherry picked from commit c8bc412e4f2aaa0c97fd107f7a5acd698c7224ff)

commit_message:
Fix idempotency for modifying lxc config

Using "regexp" instead of "insertafter" keeps modifying
lxc config tasks idempotent.

Change-Id: I48485488394894489cc0e407edac0e7014a56901
Closes-Bug: 1862625

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-10 14:16:09.000000000', 'message': '[train-squash] Backport tripleo-keystone-resources role

The role has proven to be stable and made the deployment a bit faster
since it's only taking a minute to create all Keystone resources with
Ansible vs more than 8 minutes with Puppet. This effort is worth a
backport to stable/train.

Introduce tripleo-keystone-resources role

This role will manage Keystone resources, like
/etc/openstack/clouds.yaml, Keystone endpoints/users/roles/etc and
everything that was managed by Puppet before regarding Keystone.

Management of Keystone resources for each OpenStack service:
- services
- projects
- endpoints
- roles
- users and their assignment to roles
- admin resources

It's using batch + async so it runs faster than with Puppet where it
calls openstack client for each resource. Here it's using the python
openstacksdk with concurrency.

Change-Id: Ib9615c55d0fb4ea71208d74c5ee22594db52f46a
(cherry picked from commit 566bcf66ce3518f1e36ccce47898fa4669dec00d)

Update override for keystone resources

The existing override was double quoting the override options which would
lead the config generator to double quote keys in the rendered data. This
change modifies the override data to make it use a jinja data structure
which will ensure we're not having to deal with quoting issues.

Change-Id: If3000457cb0c4fcd07082057ee801d30ff4a10e9
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 30c7de49b0e56d335c02aa8d62d24d6c0952e24e)

tripleo-keystone-resources: fix a typo for domains creation

The variable was wrong for the loop item, this patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I095a60421ec1ecb60fdbf14cf7788a82492ed651
(cherry picked from commit 71d09973289014a3d98379bbec6b7e1ca89bebf5)

tripleo-keystone-resources: handle multiple roles per user

os_user_role module can only assign one role to a user.
If a user needs multiple roles, we need a filter to build a dict where
each key is a user with a list of the assigned roles.

Change-Id: I3aff5f25b90affceacdf95d0f2725ed740761b70
(cherry picked from commit 478daa5471fa3cf5261614d0ff4fdbb18fc584ae)

Data structure changes for tripleo-keystone-resources role

While reviewing the first implementation it appears that we can extend
the data structure to make it so we wouldn't need extra Ansible tasks to
handle other Keystone resources needed by some services like barbican,
ceilometer or heat.

This change does the following:

- remove "container" related variable name from "haskey" filter, as we
  will recycle it from the tripleo-keystone-resources role.
- keystone endpoints will be found under "endpoints" and not "urls".
- keystone endpoints data will be built from the keystone_resources
  dictionary only if endpoints are specified in the dict items.
  The loop-endpoints will loop over a list of keystone resources which
  contain "endpoints" key. However, it needs access to some other keys
  during the endpoint creation so we re-used that filter.
- Same for Keystone Services, with "service" attribute.
- Re-use "get_key_from_dict" filter to get all Keystone users to create.
  This can be done because the function will return only the key and its
  value when present, create a list and then we pass it to the users
  playbook.
  We do the same for the user roles assignment, but we also apply the
  "get_role_assignments" filter, to build the proper data structure so
  role assignement is done correctly.
- Allow to create extra roles and domains.
- Allow to override the default domain when creating a user.
- Modify "get_role_assignments" filter so if a domain is specified, the
  user is assigned to the role in a domain and not in a project.
  If on domain is specified, we assign it into a project, and the
  default is set by tripleo_keystone_resources_service_project where the
  default is "service" by legacy.
  The data structure of the returned value changed, to work with this
  complex situation (in Keystone v3, domain & project are mutually
  exclusive when doing role assignment).
- Add tripleo_keystone_resources_batch variable and set to 10 by
  default, so we'll manage 10 resources at the same time in async to
  speed things up.
- Create get_domain_id() filter to go over all domains and get a domain
  id from a domain name. Unfortunately, the module that list all domains
  changed in Ansible 2.9.1 so we have 2 kind of playbooks to support old
  and new style to gather all domains infos.

The new structure looks like the following:

      keystone_resources:
        nova:
          service: compute
          region: RegionOne
          endpoints:
            public: https://public-nova:8774
            admin: https://admin-nova:8774
            internal: https://internal-nova:8774
          users:
            nova:
              password: secretenova
              roles:
                - admin
                - service
              domain: nova_extra_domain
          roles:
            - nova_extra_role
          domains:
            - nova_extra_domain

Change-Id: Ia68f8852662fb4abbd194954a246afb740bf3f71
(cherry picked from commit 44204ec6b235cd780d44cb3b8fce78e4c10a8548)
'}]
commit_message:
[train-squash] Backport tripleo-keystone-resources role

The role has proven to be stable and made the deployment a bit faster
since it's only taking a minute to create all Keystone resources with
Ansible vs more than 8 minutes with Puppet. This effort is worth a
backport to stable/train.

Introduce tripleo-keystone-resources role

This role will manage Keystone resources, like
/etc/openstack/clouds.yaml, Keystone endpoints/users/roles/etc and
everything that was managed by Puppet before regarding Keystone.

Management of Keystone resources for each OpenStack service:
- services
- projects
- endpoints
- roles
- users and their assignment to roles
- admin resources

It's using batch + async so it runs faster than with Puppet where it
calls openstack client for each resource. Here it's using the python
openstacksdk with concurrency.

Change-Id: Ib9615c55d0fb4ea71208d74c5ee22594db52f46a
(cherry picked from commit 566bcf66ce3518f1e36ccce47898fa4669dec00d)

Update override for keystone resources

The existing override was double quoting the override options which would
lead the config generator to double quote keys in the rendered data. This
change modifies the override data to make it use a jinja data structure
which will ensure we're not having to deal with quoting issues.

Change-Id: If3000457cb0c4fcd07082057ee801d30ff4a10e9
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 30c7de49b0e56d335c02aa8d62d24d6c0952e24e)

tripleo-keystone-resources: fix a typo for domains creation

The variable was wrong for the loop item, this patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I095a60421ec1ecb60fdbf14cf7788a82492ed651
(cherry picked from commit 71d09973289014a3d98379bbec6b7e1ca89bebf5)

tripleo-keystone-resources: handle multiple roles per user

os_user_role module can only assign one role to a user.
If a user needs multiple roles, we need a filter to build a dict where
each key is a user with a list of the assigned roles.

Change-Id: I3aff5f25b90affceacdf95d0f2725ed740761b70
(cherry picked from commit 478daa5471fa3cf5261614d0ff4fdbb18fc584ae)

Data structure changes for tripleo-keystone-resources role

While reviewing the first implementation it appears that we can extend
the data structure to make it so we wouldn't need extra Ansible tasks to
handle other Keystone resources needed by some services like barbican,
ceilometer or heat.

This change does the following:

- remove "container" related variable name from "haskey" filter, as we
  will recycle it from the tripleo-keystone-resources role.
- keystone endpoints will be found under "endpoints" and not "urls".
- keystone endpoints data will be built from the keystone_resources
  dictionary only if endpoints are specified in the dict items.
  The loop-endpoints will loop over a list of keystone resources which
  contain "endpoints" key. However, it needs access to some other keys
  during the endpoint creation so we re-used that filter.
- Same for Keystone Services, with "service" attribute.
- Re-use "get_key_from_dict" filter to get all Keystone users to create.
  This can be done because the function will return only the key and its
  value when present, create a list and then we pass it to the users
  playbook.
  We do the same for the user roles assignment, but we also apply the
  "get_role_assignments" filter, to build the proper data structure so
  role assignement is done correctly.
- Allow to create extra roles and domains.
- Allow to override the default domain when creating a user.
- Modify "get_role_assignments" filter so if a domain is specified, the
  user is assigned to the role in a domain and not in a project.
  If on domain is specified, we assign it into a project, and the
  default is set by tripleo_keystone_resources_service_project where the
  default is "service" by legacy.
  The data structure of the returned value changed, to work with this
  complex situation (in Keystone v3, domain & project are mutually
  exclusive when doing role assignment).
- Add tripleo_keystone_resources_batch variable and set to 10 by
  default, so we'll manage 10 resources at the same time in async to
  speed things up.
- Create get_domain_id() filter to go over all domains and get a domain
  id from a domain name. Unfortunately, the module that list all domains
  changed in Ansible 2.9.1 so we have 2 kind of playbooks to support old
  and new style to gather all domains infos.

The new structure looks like the following:

      keystone_resources:
        nova:
          service: compute
          region: RegionOne
          endpoints:
            public: https://public-nova:8774
            admin: https://admin-nova:8774
            internal: https://internal-nova:8774
          users:
            nova:
              password: secretenova
              roles:
                - admin
                - service
              domain: nova_extra_domain
          roles:
            - nova_extra_role
          domains:
            - nova_extra_domain

Change-Id: Ia68f8852662fb4abbd194954a246afb740bf3f71
(cherry picked from commit 44204ec6b235cd780d44cb3b8fce78e4c10a8548)

commit_message:
tripleo-config: add tripleo_config_remote_src option

tripleo_config_remote_src can be used to set remote_src for
config_template module.

commit_message:
tripleo-config: use become by default

The config files can be written in /etc (most of the times), so we need
sudo to write the files without permission error.

Change-Id: I68911dcec1d92def25e3b48fb1319564eda292f0
(cherry picked from commit b9b23c56000c1f2b4520994d962aad582b550bdd)

controlling that resource and not Puppet.

commit_message:
Add keystone_resources_managed option to the cinder api class

Add the keystone_resources_managed toggle so we can let Ansible
controlling that resource and not Puppet.

It's part of the efforts to not rely on Puppet to create Cloud resources
like keystone resources, cinder types, etc.

Change-Id: I557d8f33c9c699aed14b3b6fc1d1c0407365cd08
(cherry picked from commit ac5c901609f22e3195134b0af8e5e5856cfb773f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-11 22:30:51.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Use domain variable instead of generic resource data

When migrating from puppet to ansible, some variables were changed to be
more specific. Included in this was the variable for domain creation,
which is used when deploying keystone with domain-specific backend
template (e.g., backing keystone domains to LDAP servers).

Recently, domain information was put into
batched_tripleo_keystone_resources_domains instead of
batched_tripleo_keystone_resources_data. This commit updates the domain
plays to use the new variable. Not doing this will result in an error
like the following on the undercloud:

  fatal: [undercloud]: FAILED! => {"msg": "'batched_tripleo_keystone_resources_data' is undefined"}

Change-Id: I33530e6e3f7ac156e07545b0455c99bb7d2274ef
'}, {'created': '2020-02-11 22:54:13.000000000', 'message': 'Use domain variable instead of generic resource data

When migrating from puppet to ansible, some variables were changed to be
more specific. Included in this was the variable for domain creation,
which is used when deploying keystone with domain-specific backend
template (e.g., backing keystone domains to LDAP servers):

  https://review.opendev.org/#/c/701026/19

Recently, domain information was put into
batched_tripleo_keystone_resources_domains instead of
batched_tripleo_keystone_resources_data. This commit updates the domain
plays to use the new variable. Not doing this will result in an error
like the following on the undercloud:

  fatal: [undercloud]: FAILED! => {"msg": "'batched_tripleo_keystone_resources_data' is undefined"}

Change-Id: I33530e6e3f7ac156e07545b0455c99bb7d2274ef
'}]
commit_message:
Use domain variable instead of generic resource data

When migrating from puppet to ansible, some variables were changed to be
more specific. Included in this was the variable for domain creation,
which is used when deploying keystone with domain-specific backend
template (e.g., backing keystone domains to LDAP servers):

  https://review.opendev.org/#/c/701026/19

Recently, domain information was put into
batched_tripleo_keystone_resources_domains instead of
batched_tripleo_keystone_resources_data. This commit updates the domain
plays to use the new variable. Not doing this will result in an error
like the following on the undercloud:

  fatal: [undercloud]: FAILED! => {"msg": "'batched_tripleo_keystone_resources_data' is undefined"}

Change-Id: I33530e6e3f7ac156e07545b0455c99bb7d2274ef

commit_message:
WIP: Copy existing image in multiple stores

Added new import method 'copy-image' which will copy existing image into
specified list of stores. Introduced additional task which will serve
as internal plugin which will allow copying existing image into staging
area and then this data will be uploaded to specified stores via regula
import flow.

NOTE: This new import method 'copy-image' is only supported if multiple
stores are enabled in deployment.

Change-Id: Icbe52793fd33ba61944ee59bbfa538003ffbfee9

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-04 22:21:49.000000000', 'message': 'Default to bootstrapping roles as immutable

In the previous cycle, the ``--immutable-roles`` option was added to the
bootstrap command as an optional way to opt-in to making the default
roles immutable. Following step 4 of the spec[1], we now make that
behavior the default and additionally offer a way to opt out of it.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/train/immutable-resources.html#proposed-change

Change-Id: I6b680efb2c87c1d7559ddcc989bbce68456b9a5f
Closes-Bug: #1823258
'}]
commit_message:
Default to bootstrapping roles as immutable

In the previous cycle, the ``--immutable-roles`` option was added to the
bootstrap command as an optional way to opt-in to making the default
roles immutable. Following step 4 of the spec[1], we now make that
behavior the default and additionally offer a way to opt out of it.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/train/immutable-resources.html#proposed-change

Change-Id: I6b680efb2c87c1d7559ddcc989bbce68456b9a5f
Closes-Bug: #1823258

commit_message:
builder: include environment when running an exec

Some container execs have an environment, let's make sure they are
included when running exec.

NOTE: This is for Rocky and below as docker was the only supported
method in these versions. Additionally in Rocky and below, the
environment was a list and not a dictionary so we only support a list
version for the environment.

Closes-Bug: #1855932
Change-Id: Ic2e2c2d50f5883f7db28768ba215e74bcbf9fd8b
(cherry picked from commit b5be45067ac1e7d3b08458e2943e8de046aeee7b)
(cherry picked from commit 0108ad789a087a9581c5cc4fbb3547f7aff45662)

'}, {'created': '2020-02-10 15:49:15.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Reduce the number of watched tables in MetadataProxyHandler

This patch changes the SB IDL from the MetadataProxyHandler class to
only watch the two required tables for it to function.

The more tables it monitors, the bigger the burden is on the OVSDB to
keep all the in-memory replicas updated. In special, the Chassis table
can generate a lot of events due to the agents health check mechanism
in the OVN driver so, removing it will prevent many events from being
sent across the fabric.

Closes-Bug: #1862648
Change-Id: Ib4fb9b445ed7fe4bce7bc05ae1b8dca264324718
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

The more tables it monitors, the bigger the burden is on the OVSDB to
keep all the in-memory replicas updated. In special, the Chassis table
can generate a lot of events due to the agents health check mechanism
in the OVN driver so, removing it will prevent many events from being

Closes-Bug: #1862648

Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Reduce the number of watched tables in MetadataProxyHandler

This patch changes the SB IDL from the MetadataProxyHandler class to
only watch the two required tables for it to function.

The more tables it monitors, the bigger the burden is on the OVSDB to
keep all the in-memory replicas updated. In special, the Chassis table
can generate a lot of events due to the agents health check mechanism
in the OVN driver so, removing it will prevent many events from being
sent across the fabric.

Closes-Bug: #1862648
Change-Id: Ib4fb9b445ed7fe4bce7bc05ae1b8dca264324718
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

- infortrend-cinder-volume-fc http://openstack.infortrend.com/1504/694954/1/check/infortrend-cinder-volume-fc/ceec56ff6a8a6a747d3a261a5b21bd9ffbc5c53b : FAILURE

- infortrend-cinder-volume-iscsi http://openstack.infortrend.com/1525/694954/1/check/infortrend-cinder-volume-iscsi/ceec56ff6a8a6a747d3a261a5b21bd9ffbc5c53b : FAILURE'}, {'account_id': 21863, 'date': '2019-11-19 10:38:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Build failed.  To recheck use 'run-INFINIDAT'.  For 3rd party ci contact info: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems

- dsvm-tempest-infinibox-fc http://openstack-ci-logs.aws.infinidat.com/54/694954/1/check/dsvm-tempest-infinibox-fc/3a7e468 : SUCCESS in 1h 02m 24s
- dsvm-tempest-infinibox-iscsi http://openstack-ci-logs.aws.infinidat.com/54/694954/1/check/dsvm-tempest-infinibox-iscsi/6af4dd8 : FAILURE in 1h 24m 11s"}, {'account_id': 21884, 'date': '2019-11-19 10:41:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Build succeed.

- DellEMC_Unity_FC http://publiclogs.emc.com/54/694954/1/check/DellEMC_Unity_FC/a1e4606/DellEMC_Unity_FC/101 : SUCCESS in 1h 08m 48s
- DellEMC_Unity_iSCSI http://publiclogs.emc.com/54/694954/1/check/DellEMC_Unity_iSCSI/c94eaa3/DellEMC_Unity_iSCSI/99 : SUCCESS in 1h 27m 47s

Leave a comment with 'run-DellEMC Unity CI' to trigger a recheck. For more information about CI, please see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems/DellEMC_Unity_CI"}, {'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2019-11-19 11:09:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

thank you, Sean McGinnis.
but i have different idea about your comment.
yes, manage volume is admin only, but this patch's main idea is cinder message-list. this change does not change the truth that only the admin can manage volume or discover unmanaged volumes, but if admin failed to manage volume in the driver layer, we just record the error. this change will not lead to expose manageable volumes to non-admin users
query user messages(cinder message-list) can be used by admin or owner, this change will help admin or owner of volume to check why manage volume faile.
So I don't think it's risky.but it is useful."}, {'account_id': 31305, 'date': '2019-11-19 13:07:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

run-INSPUR CI'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-11-19 16:20:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

There's some ambiguity over the term 'user' here.  As Sean points out, the user making the manage-volume call is an Administrator.  The user accessing user messages is an end user (or admin) who can see all the user messages for all resources in the end user's project.

So Sean is correct that this patch will allow leakage of the fact that there was a failed Administrative action attempted on a resource.  I think there are two questions here:

(1) Do we care if this info gets out?  (I think the answer is yes, we should not leak Administrative info out to end users, but I'm open to other opinions.)

(2) Would it be useful for Administrators to be able to see this info as a user message instead of hunting for it in a log?  (I think haixin would say "yes" to this, that's the point of this patch.)  If that's the case, we need to change the code so that "admin actions" aren't shown to non-admin users.

BTW, it looks like we're currently leaking volume unmanage info (also a default admin API action; unmanaging encrypted volumes is not supported):
https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/src/commit/6b0624f4d3082da6473f07bfb55e0d484148b339/cinder/volume/api.py#L435

That isn't to say we should leak this info, too, it's just to say that we should take a more careful look at this.

haixin, if you'd like to continue with this, maybe you could put it on the weekly meeting agenda?  Let me know if the meeting time isn't good for your time zone, and I can bring it up for you.'}, {'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2019-11-21 01:05:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

thank you,Brian Rosmaita,
(1)Do we care if this info get out?
   i don't think the answer is yes,the all thing of end users can get from user messages is 'resource_type' 'resource_uuid' ''project_id' 'event_id'.it means end users only know admin has failed to manage or unmange an volume,but end users does not know the host and name of the volume.Data for this volume cannot be obtained or tampered by end users. so i think it is also safe for admin.
(2) The risk as described, it looks like a project manager can get user messages, which belong to other projects,it is also risk.

   So, i think we should discuss whether this is risk.If it turns out to be risky, we should try to change the code so that "admin actions" aren't shown to non-admin users.
   
   At last,i want to continue with this,but weekly meeting is to late for me,please bring it up in the next meeting,i will view the discussion record,thank you!'}, {'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2020-02-12 05:13:28.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add asynchronous error info into messages when manage volume failed

when user to manage a volume to cinder.if the source-name of request body does
not existing in backend storage,it will lead to manage failed. this is an
asynchronous process, but this asynchronous error is not logged in user
messages.This will help the user quickly know why the manage existing volume
failed.

Change-Id: Ib7c66cc6efe58a2f0aa8223a757b917fbdf3d1ac
Close-Bug:#1852710

[{'created': '2020-02-11 11:44:29.000000000', 'message': 'Fix logging libvirt error on python 3

This patch fixes error caused by absence of "message"
attribute in libvirtError when running on python 3.
ceilometer-agent-compute service fails to fetch
domain metadata and tries to log libvirt error,
during logging the following exception is raised and
service fails:
AttributeError: 'libvirtError' object has no attribute
'message'

Change-Id: I56e74d1cb30310db104c850e74b2d422d3aeb966
'}]
commit_message:
Fix logging libvirt error on python 3

This patch fixes error caused by absence of "message"
attribute in libvirtError when running on python 3.
ceilometer-agent-compute service fails to fetch
domain metadata and tries to log libvirt error,
during logging the following exception is raised and
service fails:
AttributeError: 'libvirtError' object has no attribute
'message'

Change-Id: I56e74d1cb30310db104c850e74b2d422d3aeb966

commit_message:
Configurable timeout of the QEMU img conversion

Instead of having a hardcoded value the conversion prlimits are
now operator configurable. These settings have always been arbitrary
as it depends on the environment.

Change-Id: I462cecc3152bf838b7d42d5abc3ca31610567e5e
Closes-Bug: #1705340

subject: [ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

'}]
commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Use modern sphinx-build command.

is used.

Change-Id: I9e74910bd0ff4ad18b830c26ce90770b0dfa107b
"}, {'created': '2020-01-30 17:58:20.000000000', 'message': "Fix freezer-api's src_file to path_to_backup

Freezer-api is not working as it is expected, returning NULL value
for src_file option in freezer_action's json returned from API.

In other words when user define action via freezer client and define
valid and WORKING action JSON with option path_to_backup
(src_file is not supported by freezer-agent anymore).

In DB we can see backup_metadata is filled correctly,
freezer-scheduler/freezer-agent working correctly as they are reading
backup_metadata. Problem is that API is still returning json with
src_file set tu NULL because src_file is not present in backup_metada,
therefore is not filled in src_file column in action table.

Src_file option was changed to path_to_backup in freezer git repository
below, but API was never changed, this patch is fixing this.

Freezer's change :
https://github.com/openstack/freezer/commit/c7f71ff70bdcc68efc2c88e736a6c39443e33ab6

Doc changes in freezer:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705003/

commit_message:
Fix freezer-api's src_file to path_to_backup

Freezer-api is not working as it is expected, returning NULL value
for src_file option in freezer_action's json returned from API.

In other words when user define action via freezer client and define
valid and WORKING action JSON with option path_to_backup
(src_file is not supported by freezer-agent anymore).

In DB we can see backup_metadata is filled correctly,
freezer-scheduler/freezer-agent working correctly as they are reading
backup_metadata. Problem is that API is still returning json with
src_file set tu NULL because src_file is not present in backup_metada,
therefore is not filled in src_file column in action table.

Src_file option was changed to path_to_backup in freezer git repository
below, but API was never changed, this patch is fixing this behaviour.

Freezer's change :
https://github.com/openstack/freezer/commit/c7f71ff70bdcc68efc2c88e736a6c39443e33ab6

Doc changes in freezer:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705003/

Change-Id: I9e74910bd0ff4ad18b830c26ce90770b0dfa107b

commit_message:
Enhance agent's resources_synced check

The fullstack test TestPlacementBandwidthReport.
test_configurations_are_synced_towards_placement sporadically failing
and one possible reason is that multiple agents are visible to the
server after restart of the agent (perhaps due to parallel execution).

Partial-Bug: #1862177
Change-Id: I79aa2cb9bcd69fc0cb35e0fd351a373e00feb062

false-positive naming (e.g., `token`).

	tox.ini

Original commit targeted the stable/queens U-C URL, this stable/pike
cherry-pick altered the tox.ini change to point to the stable/pike URL.

Change-Id: Ie03e6970e0d45a3f066a87cdca8a6e1f98f51634
(cherry picked from commit d68942d03d1628b0cc209024ec5966bc74f2f6d0)
'}]
commit_message:
Update stable/queens upper constraints file location

Tox fails locally When running ``tox -e bandit`` due to a 302 redirect
pointing to the new location of the upper-constraints file, mainly due
to the migration to opendev.

This commit also constrains bandit to version 1.5.1 or earlier since
version 1.6.0 introduces some additional checks that fail on
false-positive naming (e.g., `token`).

Conflicts:
	tox.ini

Original commit targeted the stable/queens U-C URL, this stable/pike
cherry-pick altered the tox.ini change to point to the stable/pike URL.

Change-Id: Ie03e6970e0d45a3f066a87cdca8a6e1f98f51634
(cherry picked from commit d68942d03d1628b0cc209024ec5966bc74f2f6d0)

commit_message:
Remove six usage

This repo does not support Python 2 anymore, so we don't need
six for compatibility between Python2 and 3, convert six usage to Python
3 code.

Change-Id: Ibc743a552a43147153dd0ca3a46ab8d977c7ca0d

[{'created': '2020-02-08 01:07:35.000000000', 'message': 'Unnecessary routers should not be created

We observe an excessive amount of routers created on
compute node on which some virtual machines got a fixed
ip on floating network.

Rpc servers should filter out those unnecessary routers
during syncing.

Change-Id: I299031a505f05cd0469e2476b867b9dbca59c5bf
Partial-Bug: #1840579
(cherry picked from commit 480b04ce04f98bae6ff4ab13cec9e01b34204134)
'}]
commit_message:
Unnecessary routers should not be created

We observe an excessive amount of routers created on
compute node on which some virtual machines got a fixed
ip on floating network.

Rpc servers should filter out those unnecessary routers
during syncing.

Change-Id: I299031a505f05cd0469e2476b867b9dbca59c5bf
Partial-Bug: #1840579
(cherry picked from commit 480b04ce04f98bae6ff4ab13cec9e01b34204134)

commit_message:
api-ref: give an example of volume['attachments']

The API samples for GET /v3/{project_id}/volumes/detail and
GET /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id} have an empty attachments
field value and the parameter description does not give the actual
keys in the attachments list of dicts. This change gives an example
of what the volume attachments entry would look like with the actual
keys the caller should expect.

Change-Id: Ib3d7d54941ee98434297683a94d76fdab7788dee

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-11 22:46:44.000000000', 'message': "umount /var/lib/ceph on init to cleanup previous run

While bringing up a devstack with ceph locally, I hit a temporary name
resolution failure in the middle of a run. When I ran stack.sh again,
the ceph setup failed with:

  ++functions:create_disk:722                sudo umount /var/lib/ceph
  umount: /var/lib/ceph: target is busy.
  +functions:create_disk:1                   exit_trap

I found that I was able to run stack.sh again successfully by killing
the ceph-osd and ceph-mon processes, then 'umount /var/lib/ceph'.

This adds the 'umount /var/lib/ceph' command to the init routine where
clean up of previous runs are handled.

Change-Id: I54c003c12972cf2581520bc92542b75f9293505f
"}]
commit_message:
umount /var/lib/ceph on init to cleanup previous run

While bringing up a devstack with ceph locally, I hit a temporary name
resolution failure in the middle of a run. When I ran stack.sh again,
the ceph setup failed with:

  ++functions:create_disk:722                sudo umount /var/lib/ceph
  umount: /var/lib/ceph: target is busy.
  +functions:create_disk:1                   exit_trap

I found that I was able to run stack.sh again successfully by killing
the ceph-osd and ceph-mon processes, then 'umount /var/lib/ceph'.

This adds the 'umount /var/lib/ceph' command to the init routine where
clean up of previous runs are handled.

Change-Id: I54c003c12972cf2581520bc92542b75f9293505f

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

qa-specs adjust the tox update for basepython to common env.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html

commit_message:
Install psutil required by tools/mlock_report.py script

'tools/mlock_report.py' script requires 'psutil' package to be
installed. This ensures it is done before memory_peak service is
started.

Partial-Bug: #1860753
Change-Id: I7b2b6eaf9856c6057e1a4a0054d15074150a6cb6

> What's the value in supporting required and default on the same field? I think only 3 cases make sense: required=True, required=False&&default=None, required=False&&default!=None. It seems that we need to change the fields in question to required=False, no?

I am not sure I understand your question, but in case of a missing field the logic being proposed is this:

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-22 15:46:20.000000000', 'message': 'Relax required Redfish fields handling

Redfish defines some of the fields in its JSON schemas as
mandatory. However, some implementations ignore this requirement
and occasionally omit some required fields in the Redfish document
tree they produce.

Failing the whole Redfish interaction basing solely on the absence
of a required (bit non-essential) field makes sushy perfect, but not
exactly practical.

This patch changes to semantics of the `default` parameter in
``Field` constructor in a way that it can inhibit otherwise fatal
failure when a select of required attributes are missing.

Along this mis/feature, some non-essential fields in Redfish
message registry have been made required and defaulted effectively
making them non-required.

Change-Id: I637f11ff9ceab398077eae19db83db396356c8dc
Story: 2006641
Task: 38362

commit_message:
Relax required Redfish fields handling

Redfish defines some of the fields in its JSON schemas as
mandatory. However, some implementations ignore this requirement
and occasionally omit some required fields in the Redfish document
tree they produce.

Failing the whole Redfish interaction basing solely on the absence
of a required (bit non-essential) field makes sushy perfect, but not
exactly practical.

This patch changes to semantics of the `default` parameter in
``Field` constructor in a way that it can inhibit otherwise fatal
failure when a select of required attributes are missing.

Along this mis/feature, some non-essential fields in Redfish
message registry have been made required and defaulted effectively
making them non-required.

Change-Id: I637f11ff9ceab398077eae19db83db396356c8dc
Story: 2006641
Task: 38362

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-04 23:47:39.000000000', 'message': 'Fix MariaDB Single Database Restore

This patchset fixes a serious database restoration problem where the
user is trying to restore a single database, but in the process of
restoring the database, the script inadvertently also removes all
tables from the other databases.

The root cause was that the mysql "--one-database" restore option
achieves the single database restoration, but somehow corrupts the
other databases. The new approach taken in this patchset is to
create a temporary database user which only has permission to
restore the chosen database, and that will leave the other databases
unharmed. This approach, which can be applied for restoring
individual databases and even database tables, was recommended in (1).
After the database is restored, the temporary user is deleted.

(1) https://mariadb.com/kb/en/restoring-data-from-dump-files/

Change-Id: I805c605ed2b424640ad6a0a379b1c0b9c0004e94
'}, {'created': '2020-02-04 23:50:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix MariaDB Single Database Restore

achieves the single database restoration, but somehow corrupts the
other databases. The new approach taken in this patchset is to
create a temporary database user which only has permission to
restore the chosen database, and that will leave the other databases
unharmed. This approach, which can be applied for restoring
individual databases and even database tables, was recommended in (1).
After the database is restored, the temporary user is deleted.

(1) https://mariadb.com/kb/en/restoring-data-from-dump-files/

Also improved some of the error handling as well.

Change-Id: I805c605ed2b424640ad6a0a379b1c0b9c0004e94

(1) https://mariadb.com/kb/en/restoring-data-from-dump-files/

commit_message:
Fix MariaDB Single Database Restore

This patchset fixes a serious database restoration problem where the
user is trying to restore a single database, but in the process of
restoring the database, the script inadvertently also removes all
tables from the other databases.

The root cause was that the mysql "--one-database" restore option
achieves the single database restoration, but somehow corrupts the
other databases. The new approach taken in this patchset is to
create a temporary database user which only has permission to
restore the chosen database, and that will leave the other databases
unharmed. This approach, which can be applied for restoring
individual databases and even database tables, was recommended in (1).
After the database is restored, the temporary user is deleted.

(1) https://mariadb.com/kb/en/restoring-data-from-dump-files/

Also improved some of the error handling as well.

Change-Id: I805c605ed2b424640ad6a0a379b1c0b9c0004e94

mons.

Change-Id: Ib85243d38f122c1993aba945b7ae943eed262dbf

Change-Id: Ib85243d38f122c1993aba945b7ae943eed262dbf

commit_message:
[Ceph-Mon] Check for ceph-mon messenger V2

This adds a new check to make sure msgr2 is enabled if it is
supported by all of the mons. When mon quorum is lost the
mons revert to the v1 protocol, which results in a Ceph
warning state if v2 is supported by all of the available
mons.

Change-Id: Ib85243d38f122c1993aba945b7ae943eed262dbf

commit_message:
[ceph-client] Enable Nautilus PG autoscaler for all ceph pools

enabling pg autoscaler across all pools will ensure pg_num is
automatically adjusted.

https://ceph.io/rados/new-in-nautilus-pg-merging-and-autotuning/

Change-Id: Ic2f635700a32c0b7e8c67ed9571efa520638474c

commit_message:
Override virtualenv to a version < 20

There are errors with the recently released virtualenv 20.0.1 which
comes preinstalled on gate images prepared by infra. As a hotfix
override to some previous version until we can find the real fix.

Change-Id: I3b447557f013934719aa357efeffb093c7f6bd95

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-06 20:03:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fix postgresql database backup issue

Currently postgresql database backup job will fail due to not having
correct permissions on the mounted PVC. This patchset corrects the
permissions on the PVC mount so that the backup pods can write to the
/var/backup directory structure.

Also there are a number of small corrections made to the error handling
for both backup and restore scripts, to be consistent with the MariaDB
backup/restore scripts.

Change-Id: Ica361764c591099e16d03a0988f73c6976583ceb
'}, {'created': '2020-02-06 20:11:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fix postgresql database backup issue

Currently postgresql database backup job will fail due to not having
correct permissions on the mounted PVC. This patchset corrects the
permissions on the PVC mount so that the backup pods can write to the
/var/backup directory structure.

Also there are a number of small corrections made to the error handling
for both backup and restore scripts, to be consistent with the MariaDB
backup/restore scripts.

Change-Id: Ica361764c591099e16d03a0988f73c6976583ceb
'}, {'created': '2020-02-06 20:22:03.000000000', 'message': 'Fix postgresql database backup issue

Currently postgresql database backup job will fail due to not having
correct permissions on the mounted PVC. This patchset corrects the
permissions on the PVC mount so that the backup pods can write to the
/var/backup directory structure.

Another problem was that pg_dumpall was not able to get the correct
password from the admin_user.conf. This may be due to the extra lines
in the file, so this patchset reads it differently in order to find
the password. This was a change to the backup and restore scripts.

Also there are a number of small corrections made to the error handling
for both backup and restore scripts, to be consistent with the MariaDB
backup/restore scripts.

Change-Id: Ica361764c591099e16d03a0988f73c6976583ceb
'}, {'created': '2020-02-10 17:39:11.000000000', 'message': 'Fix postgresql database backup issue

Currently postgresql database backup job will fail due to not having
correct permissions on the mounted PVC. This patchset corrects the
permissions on the PVC mount so that the backup pods can write to the
/var/backup directory structure.

Another problem was that pg_dumpall was not able to get the correct
password from the admin_user.conf. This may be due to the extra lines
in the file, so this patchset reads it differently in order to find
the password. This was a change to the backup and restore scripts.

Also there are a number of small corrections made to the error handling
for both backup and restore scripts, to be consistent with the MariaDB
backup/restore scripts.

Change-Id: Ica361764c591099e16d03a0988f73c6976583ceb
'}]
commit_message:
Fix postgresql database backup issue

Currently postgresql database backup job will fail due to not having
correct permissions on the mounted PVC. This patchset corrects the
permissions on the PVC mount so that the backup pods can write to the
/var/backup directory structure.

Another problem was that pg_dumpall was not able to get the correct
password from the admin_user.conf. This may be due to the extra lines
in the file, so this patchset reads it differently in order to find
the password. This was a change to the backup and restore scripts.

Also there are a number of small corrections made to the error handling
for both backup and restore scripts, to be consistent with the MariaDB
backup/restore scripts.

Change-Id: Ica361764c591099e16d03a0988f73c6976583ceb

commit_message:
Change fetch_fernet_tokens.py behaviour to check for minimum number of tokens

Change is required to properly implement logic in fernet-node-sync.sh on
kolla-ansible side - to add a check if fernet key store is populated with
required number of tokens.

Change-Id: I51ed61e34a1dd79532b4528e56a9cd9011d46e6d
Related-Bug: #1846789
(cherry picked from commit 267cb8b14ae8472d00e09c2b5e35bda7de2de54f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-24 05:31:39.000000000', 'message': 'Fix: Create new cache entry when xtremio reaches snap limit

When we reach xtremio_volumes_per_glance_cache, it is not able
to create more clones for the image-volume therefore requires to
create a new cache entry.
Keeping in mind the case in [1], we can get CinderException for
various reasons from different drivers during the clone operation.
So we define a new exception for the xtremio driver to force create
a new cache entry when the limit reaches and not enforce the same
for other drivers.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1552734

Closes-Bug: #1858169

Change-Id: I2bf964d5a7b2048db9be1ea3eb97cd517e112c5b
(cherry picked from commit d22e54c254954bba5b91c38a266308a252c7b62a)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix: Create new cache entry when xtremio reaches snap limit

When we reach xtremio_volumes_per_glance_cache, it is not able
to create more clones for the image-volume therefore requires to
create a new cache entry.
Keeping in mind the case in [1], we can get CinderException for
various reasons from different drivers during the clone operation.
So we define a new exception for the xtremio driver to force create
a new cache entry when the limit reaches and not enforce the same
for other drivers.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1552734

Closes-Bug: #1858169

Change-Id: I2bf964d5a7b2048db9be1ea3eb97cd517e112c5b
(cherry picked from commit d22e54c254954bba5b91c38a266308a252c7b62a)

commit_message:
Stop testing python 2 in tox.

Remove python 2 from envlist parameter. Check the link:

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

The plan is drop the python 2 support from OpenStack in Ussuri release.
Move the basepython parameter.

Change-Id: I6787026195c8852386f7186fe697b724051a9684

messages: [{'account_id': 9373, 'date': '2020-02-01 22:10:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2020-02-04 16:12:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2020-02-04 16:37:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nCloses a bug, already merged in master'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2020-02-11 16:36:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-01 22:10:40.000000000', 'message': 'Always have username in CADF initiator

The current initiator object for CADF notifications does not include
the username of the user who initiated the action, which leads to
issues when using an LDAP backend and not having a direct way to
map a username to a user id.

This change makes it so that the initiator object for CADF
notifications always contains the username for a user as well
as the user id. This follows along with the CADF standard
for OpenStack[0].

[0] https://www.dmtf.org/sites/default/files/standards/documents/DSP2038_1.1.0.pdf#page=12

Closes-Bug: #1856904

Change-Id: I833e6e0d7792acf49f816050ad7a63e8ea4f702f
(cherry picked from commit 95edaaab06c6da761411ef97bc2545d86d579215)
'}]
commit_message:
Always have username in CADF initiator

The current initiator object for CADF notifications does not include
the username of the user who initiated the action, which leads to
issues when using an LDAP backend and not having a direct way to
map a username to a user id.

This change makes it so that the initiator object for CADF
notifications always contains the username for a user as well
as the user id. This follows along with the CADF standard
for OpenStack[0].

[0] https://www.dmtf.org/sites/default/files/standards/documents/DSP2038_1.1.0.pdf#page=12

Closes-Bug: #1856904

Change-Id: I833e6e0d7792acf49f816050ad7a63e8ea4f702f
(cherry picked from commit 95edaaab06c6da761411ef97bc2545d86d579215)

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

kayobe is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: Idbbdd96ff23846d29833c5997d1e32e65b5169f2

commit_message:
Remove static reference to InternalApi network

The InternalApi network had a hard-coded reference in
multiple-nics-vlans, this change removes that hard-coded
reference and replaces it with the correct reference.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/706196/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705757/
Change-Id: I0a675ffb7e42c544a861c58c921e3d3e3c0cc7c2
Closes-bug: 1861356

commit_message:
Drop py3.5 from tempest plugins

As per the community goal drop python2.7 [1], tempest is dropping
py3.5 and asked to drop from its plugins too.

[1]lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-February/012310.html

Change-Id: I40d40c58a77c58533da543d59cdb4549a1d20d45

commit_message:
Release futurist 2.0.0

This version officially drop the python 2 support so we release a major
version of futurist to inform user that we break
the backward compatibility.

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
-
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: I59ec7d1305245abe224876924636a18c019fec5d

commit_message:
Release oslo.versionedobjects 2.0.0

This version officially drop the python 2 support so we release a major
version of oslo.versionedobjects to inform user that we break
the backward compatibility.

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
-
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: I0be09bb120cc55543032a45ff155221a93dd12dc

region where we expect keystone resources like ceilometer user are
created.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-31 20:57:25.000000000', 'message': 'OVN Metadata agent gets OVSDB updates for only its Chassis

The metadata agent registers the Chassis table with ovsdb-server
and therefor gets database updates every time *any* Chassis is
updated--even if the update is just a liveness check that updates
nb_cfg.

This patch adds a condition so that metadata agent only gets updates
for the Chassis that it is running on.

Change-Id: I452b7de09312ecea621c4b448cc63f037cad9675
Related-bug: #1861092
'}, {'created': '2020-01-31 21:32:40.000000000', 'message': 'OVN Metadata agent gets OVSDB updates for only its Chassis

The metadata agent registers the Chassis table with ovsdb-server
and therefor gets database updates every time *any* Chassis is
updated--even if the update is just a liveness check that updates
nb_cfg.

This patch adds a condition so that metadata agent only gets updates
for the Chassis that it is running on.

commit_message:
OVN Metadata agent gets OVSDB updates for only its Chassis

The metadata agent registers the Chassis table with ovsdb-server
and therefor gets database updates every time *any* Chassis is
updated--even if the update is just a liveness check that updates
nb_cfg.

This patch adds a condition so that metadata agent only gets updates
for the Chassis that it is running on.

Change-Id: I452b7de09312ecea621c4b448cc63f037cad9675
Related-bug: #1861092

commit_message:
Fix team names in liaisons file

Team names in liaison files did not match team name in governance,
creating issues assessing liaisons in check_approval.

Also documentation is no longer a project team, so should be removed
from liaison file.

Change-Id: I33cf559396638054218ba65c8b1f725e47660a71

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

python-karborclient is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: I777e4ecb3dbb1bea98a9a8c2e5bde1ee4129cc0f

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in Ussuri cycle.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
-
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: Ia7abd5c3861978dbcbc7c72f469d19ff41032c13
Sem-Ver: api-break

commit_message:
Fix multiprocessing call in unit test

This patch fixes the call to ApplyResult from the multiprocessing
pool module.
The error presents itself more clearly when running tests using
Python 3.8, and that's why it's not been noticed so far.
The change in behavior in Python 3.8 will raise the error:
AttributeError: 'dict' object has no attribute '_cache'

Change-Id: I6717ebf5fef0d32120c9386ab8e47cc81f328493

commit_message:
Allow beat processors to be defined through configuration data

Processors for each of the beats are currently defined per template and
can be configured directly via template or once deployed. This change
allows processors for all or a subset of beats to be configured through
role data or via an overlay inventory.

Change-Id: I71fc96611082555b43fd0f505219c42c890464ef

Bump python-aodhclient to v2.0.0

- Drop Python 2.7 support.
- Added quota CLI support.

commit_message:
Remove setup.cfg, setup.py

This project is not a Python project and doesn't need packaging. Remove
it.

Change-Id: Id8d3be8830908f8e7cffdccc8b8ab09690db8481
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

(1 comment)

let's find the real cause of this issue. This seems interesting to me and might find out hidden bug in Tempest. let's not workaround that."}, {'account_id': 17896, 'date': '2019-10-02 20:52:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2019-10-02 21:50:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: -Code-Review

Agree with gmann that the best approach is to fix this issue Tempest side rather than implement a workaround which can obscure the true root cause.'}, {'account_id': 17896, 'date': '2019-10-03 21:41:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17896, 'date': '2019-10-07 23:52:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

'user_id' and 'tenant_id' are not part of Credentials self._initial (https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/lib/auth.py#L667) and therefore are not restored when self.clear_auth is called:

The reason why they are not part of self._initial is because with pre-provisioned creds, these fields are not in the accounts.yaml that we use. They can be added to the accounts.yaml manually, but that is overkill.

When self.clear_auth is called:
https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/lib/auth.py#L251
the credentials are reset, and only those fields that belong to the Credentials self._initial are restored in the '_apply_credentials' method: https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/lib/auth.py#L678

The Credentials reset method could be re-written in https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/lib/auth.py to force self._initial to include all keys that were defined in the Credentials object:

    def reset(self):
        # First delete all known attributes
        for key in self.ATTRIBUTES:
            if getattr(self, key) is not None:
                # add all known attributes to self._initial so that no cred attributes are 
                # missing when _apply_credentials is called
                self._initial.update({key: getattr(self, key)})
                delattr(self, key)
        # Then re-apply initial setup
        self._apply_credentials(self._initial)

Any other suggestion on how to fix in Tempest would be helpful. I do not think what I am proposing above will be accepted in Tempest and especially into Tempest lib. Until a fix is made in Tempest, can this please be merged as a workaround then later reverted when someone can fix the 'bug' in Tempest? I am not completely sure this is even a bug in Tempest especially given this: https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/lib/auth.py#L664"}, {'account_id': 17887, 'date': '2020-02-11 13:12:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: -Code-Review

(1 comment)'}]

commit_message:
Fix 'use_dynamic_credentials = false' with Neutron extension tests

When running Neutron extension tests and Tempest configured with
'use_dynamic_credentials = false' the user_id and tenant_id are unset
and results in the tests not being executed: "Could not find user: None."

Both user_id and tenant_id are needed in rbac_utils [0].

[0] https://github.com/openstack/patrole/blob/master/patrole_tempest_plugin/rbac_utils.py#L163

Change-Id: I88d0624bc279b004ebe5f721cdef5adf12bd0ed9

commit_message:
Fix logging libvirt error on python 3

This patch fixes error caused by absence of "message"
attribute in libvirtError when running on python 3.
ceilometer-agent-compute service fails to fetch
domain metadata and tries to log libvirt error,
during logging the following exception is raised and
service fails:
AttributeError: 'libvirtError' object has no attribute
'message'

Change-Id: I56e74d1cb30310db104c850e74b2d422d3aeb966

subject: Add live_migration_scheme to Train configuration template
messages:
[{'account_id': 28014, 'date': '2020-02-10 16:20:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28014, 'date': '2020-02-10 16:22:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2020-02-10 17:06:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Thank you for catching and providing a patch for this. The context condition is for >= ocata, that would mean that pike is also hit by this.  Would you mind add a similar update to the pike template too?'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2020-02-10 17:07:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Let's not forget queens"}, {'account_id': 28014, 'date': '2020-02-10 17:29:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 28014, 'date': '2020-02-10 17:38:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Copy from IRC for future reference:

I think the issue is only present to train. That happens because the check of live_migration_scheme was present to all templates ocata, pike, queens, rocky, stein but no train[1-5].

On the other hand, all of them have a check for live_migration_uri which is never set by python context[6], thus, I will remove it with this patch.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/charm-nova-compute/blob/master/templates/ocata/nova.conf#L218
[2] https://github.com/openstack/charm-nova-compute/blob/master/templates/pike/nova.conf#L219
[3] https://github.com/openstack/charm-nova-compute/blob/master/templates/queens/nova.conf#L237
[4] https://github.com/openstack/charm-nova-compute/blob/master/templates/rocky/nova.conf#L237
[5] https://github.com/openstack/charm-nova-compute/blob/master/templates/stein/nova.conf#L238
[6] https://github.com/openstack/charm-nova-compute/blob/master/hooks/nova_compute_context.py#L205'}, {'account_id': 28014, 'date': '2020-02-10 18:13:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2020-02-11 06:08:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

LGTM, I would like one more core reviewer to approve as we are in freze and close to release.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2020-02-11 11:38:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

[{'created': '2020-02-10 16:20:35.000000000', 'message': 'Use live_migration_scheme instead of deprecated live_migration_uri
which is not set by charm code on versions greater than Ocata.

Change-Id: Id19a0e72dad28fbd729002ec1dfb7cf4acfcf2bc
Closes-Bug: #1862659
Signed-off-by: Stamatis Katsaounis <katsaouniss@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-02-10 16:22:41.000000000', 'message': 'Remove live_migration_uri from Train template

Use live_migration_scheme instead of deprecated live_migration_uri
which is not set by charm code on versions greater than Ocata.

Change-Id: Id19a0e72dad28fbd729002ec1dfb7cf4acfcf2bc
Closes-Bug: #1862659
Signed-off-by: Stamatis Katsaounis <skatsaounis@admin.grnet.gr>
'}, {'created': '2020-02-10 17:29:35.000000000', 'message': 'Add live_migration_scheme to Train configuration template

Use live_migration_scheme instead of deprecated live_migration_uri
which is not set by charm code on versions greater than Ocata.
Furthermore, remove the check from every template >= Ocata because
live_migration_uri is never set by nova_compute_context.py (L205)

Change-Id: Id19a0e72dad28fbd729002ec1dfb7cf4acfcf2bc
Closes-Bug: #1862659
Signed-off-by: Stamatis Katsaounis <skatsaounis@admin.grnet.gr>
'}]
commit_message:
Add live_migration_scheme to Train configuration template

Use live_migration_scheme instead of deprecated live_migration_uri
which is not set by charm code on versions greater than Ocata.
Furthermore, remove the check from every template >= Ocata because
live_migration_uri is never set by nova_compute_context.py (L205)

Change-Id: Id19a0e72dad28fbd729002ec1dfb7cf4acfcf2bc
Closes-Bug: #1862659
Signed-off-by: Stamatis Katsaounis <skatsaounis@admin.grnet.gr>

Add info about required RBAC permissions to docs

This commit adds information about required Kuryr Kubernetes user
permissions when RBAC is enabled to manual installation guide.

commit_message:
Add support for retired{_reason} fields.

This change adds support to set and unset the 'retired'
and 'retired_reason' fields. It also extends the 'list'
command with an additional '--retired' parameter to
list only nodes which have the retired property.

Story: #2005425
Task: #38143
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/703981
Change-Id: I5fe379c4ff439b3a083ae819ce5b4bdbddd22b3a

commit_message:
Revert "Disable neutron-ovn-tempest-ovs-release temporarily"

This reverts commit 5b12d808aa3255a595bc2f8ee01411819b5b72f3.

Fixes for this issue on nova's side [1] and [2] are already
merged so let's make neutron-ovn job voting again.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705760
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/706213/

Change-Id: I1117a8195af5a5b3eb2faa7a920e9d66747846dc

Change-Id: I560ab5260bed7e43d83b67a00057ac48f9e366e9

commit_message:
Remove registry related functional and unit tests

Registry service is deprecated and due for removal since past
couple of cycles. This patch removes functional and unit tests of
registry.

NOTE:
Skipped 'test_create_with_live_time' test as it was dependent on
test_registry_client and test_registry_api modules. Something is
wrong with the test and will be corrected once entire registry code
is removed from the code base.

commit_message:
waiters: Add wait_for_volume_attachment_remove

This change adds a specific waiter for tracking the removal of
attachments from a volume. This should allow callers to track the
detaching of multiattached volumes from instances while the volume
remains in an `in-use` state.

Related-bug: #1858841
Change-Id: I85917f683d2bc81fdf3f6d3351bf56fdb649740e

commit_message:
Run Glance initialization when Glance is enabled, not just registry (v2)

Per [1] Glance registry should not be required to run since Queens.

v2 improves on v1 [2] (now reverted [3]) by applying minor comments
from reviews so far and ensuring nova-live-migration job does not see
a change in behavior and hence does not break [4].
[5] tried to fix the issue but it did only partially, regarding
the database but not the image upload [6].
This patch ensures double cirros image upload does not happen as well.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/glance-specs/specs/queens/approved/glance/deprecate-registry.html
[2] https://review.opendev.org/702707
[3] https://review.opendev.org/703131
[4] https://bugs.launchpad.net/devstack/+bug/1860021
[5] https://review.opendev.org/702960
[6] https://bugs.launchpad.net/devstack/+bug/1860021/comments/16

Change-Id: I61538acd6bd4c7b3da26c4084225b220d7d1aa2c
Closes-bug: #1859847
Related-bug: #1860021

commit_message:
Fixes fluentd for rocky

Pin fluent-plugin-elasticsearch to 4.0.0

fluent-plugin-elasticsearch now requires at least ruby 2.3 which is
not possible to run on ubuntu/debian for rocky after
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/704040/

[1] https://rubygems.org/gems/fluent-plugin-elasticsearch/versions/4.0.0
[2] https://rubygems.org/gems/fluent-plugin-elasticsearch/versions/4.0.1

Closes-Bug: #1862522

Change-Id: I94695b03791b1028d528052d772fc302ab8080ee
